page.title: 02CUSTOMS IN BIRCH PART ONE
page.content: Many of the{village customs}revolve around the church and school. These customs are also linked with the villages of Birch,Layer Breton and sometimes Layer Marney, the three parishes looked after by the same vicar. Farming is closely linked with these customs. { JANUARY}- On Plough Sunday there is the custom of blessing the work of the farmers at the beginning of the year. { FEBRUARY}- Early in the month we celebrate Education Sunday with exhibitions of the childrens work and parents and staff invited to a service. { APRIL}- A Palm Sunday procession leaves Layer Breton Church led by a boy dressed as Jesus and riding a donkey. All local organisations are involved with a sevice in Birch church completing the event.
